debug messages, at a slight runtime performance cost. notify-level-glgsg
controls which severity levels are shown. gl-debug-abort-level enum fatal Set this to a setting other than 'fatal' to cause an abort to be
triggered when an error of the indicated severity level (or a more
severe one) occurs. This is useful if you want to attach a debugger. If
you set this, it is highly recommended to also set gl-debug-synchronous,
since the call stack will otherwise not point to the GL call that
triggered the error message. This feature is not available when NDEBUG
has been defined. gl-debug-buffers bool 0 Set this true, in addition to enabling debug notify for glgsg, to
enable debug messages about the creation and destruction of OpenGL
